mainText.attr1: Ship Orders - Gravity Drive Use:
Key Point:
For ships to use their gravity drive - click the - permit gravity drive - button (see image).
This is done on a - per order - basis.
For example:
You issued a go to command - to a far away base
You clicked the permit g-drive button
You cancelled that order
If you issue another order - you will need to permit g-drive use again
The issue:
If you read one of the earlier topics - it talked about the contradiction of making ships independent and obedient.
Gravity drive use smacks into a variant of this as well.
Gravity drive is can be used to travel long distances.
Gravity drive has to use the nearest hop.
Gravity drive could potentially lead to ships getting into trouble.
Players might want to use standard engines for travel, or the g-drive.
This is an unknown and widely situational.
Therefore - gravity drive use is under the player's control.
Special cases:
There are a few cases where ships will always use the g-drive.
Formation leader used the g-drive
If delivering cargo pods
If headed towards a friendly base
Other cases - where speed and simplicity tend to win.
Not all ships have a g-drive - mostly drones.
